boardgame.name: VivaJava
VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
boardgame.description: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; or, more simply, VivaJava Dice _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; is the successor to the well-received 2012 release of VivaJava: The Coffee Game. As in its predecessor, players of VivaJava Dice take on the roles of employees at the VivaJava CoffeeCo., scouring the globe for the best beans to keep the company on top while keeping themselves one step ahead of the rest of the executives._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Also as in VivaJava, VivaJava Dice has players making the crucial decision between blending beans and research, but with a quick, new twist. Players must now use the dice in their pool to blend _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; using the beans to create a best-seller for quick points, then deciding whether to press their luck in subsequent rounds for bigger points but fewer dice as the blends degrade _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; or to research, which involves using their valuable beans to gain an ever-changing variety of dice-manipulating abilities, new ways to score, and paths that lead to aiding a competitor for a later payoff or hindering that competitor for immediate gratification. VivaJava Dice also offers a unique system of cooperative dice-rolling that can help you rise to the top, but at the price of someone else riding your coattails._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;With an astounding mix of plug-and-play research abilities, subtle social play in semi-cooperative mode, and the chance to hog all the glory and blend the best for yourself, VivaJava Dice is all about choice, making each game fast and furiously different._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 020 – I, Geek Interviews T.C. Petty, III
Ep. 21 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Spiel des Jahres Trivia _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Predictions | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 23: Board Game Challenges Report for Quarter #1
Episode 29: Affliction: Salem 1692, Holmes: Sherlock _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Mycroft, VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game, Notre Dame, Sola fide
Episode 77 Origins preview, Buonocore drops by, and Xmen chat (spoilers)
Episode 8: Super Dungeon Explore: Forgotten King, Timecop, and Battleheart: Legacy

2014 Greater Than Games. Played, complete, in very good condition.

Played once. Kickstarter Version with many extras including tiles and coffee bag. Item is in very good condition. I treat my games very well. If there are components inside the game they are most likely bagged in 4mm, thick bags. I ship via USPS, which is most cost effective. When I ship things I take extra measurers to mitigate any potential shipping damage. Shipping from 98012. Here’s some shipping ESTIMATES to help you get an idea of what it will cost. Your distance from my Zip Code (98012) and box weight are the biggest factors in price. Please ask ahead of time if you want to know your shipping! If you place an order and cancel it after I provide you with shipping, you will get negative feedback. Small Card Game (i.e. 6 nimmt or Hanabi) $3-$6 / USPS First Class or Priority Bubble Mailer Thin Medium Sized (i.e. Concept, Las Vegas) $8-$10 / Priority Mail Thick Medium Sized (i.e. Istanbul, King of Tokyo, Russian Railroads) $10-$13 / Priority Mail Big Box Games (i.e. Ticket to Ride, 7 Wonders) $16-$18 / Priority Mail or Parcel Post Oversized or Odd Shaped Boxes ($22-$25) / Parcel Post

Reserved for Jakatoma for pickup at Gen Con Please submit payment via PayPal, Google Wallet or Venmo to gramaw@gmail.com. Alternatively, you may pay, via one of these methods or COD, directly at the convention. Since I am selling so many games I plan to meet as many buyers as possible on Saturday morning at 9AM outside of hall A on level 1 of the convention center, near room 128 (this was the former location of multiple Gen Con Math trade meetups, in case you are familiar.) You can find a link to a map of the denoted area here: https://boardgamegeek.com/image/4236187/gramaw If at all possible please meet me at this time and location. If this will not be possible, please Geekmail me so we can make an alternative arrangement. Lastly, my phone number is 847.454.6369 if you need to reach me at the convention.
